newsitem.title: USA: Aliant Communications seeks to expand.
newsitem.headline: Aliant Communications seeks to expand.

text.p: Aliant Communications Inc said Friday one of its affiliated companies applied to the Nebraska Public Service Commission for authority to expand its local telephone exchange service.
It expects the approval process to be completed by the end of March 1997.

Aliant wants to expand into Omaha and other areas served by U S West Communications Group, GTE Corp and Sprint Corp which operates in Nebraska as United Telecom, an Aliant spokesman said in a telephone interview.
Aliant said it seeks to expand outside its traditional 22-county southeast Nebraska market.
It said it would use its own equipment as well as resell other companies' service including "unbundling" or breaking out individual billing elements.

"We have been doing business outside our traditional telephone exchange market for some time, providing cellular service and business systems to customers across Nebraska," president and chief operating officer Frank Hilsabeck said in a statement.
